title: 'The Glorias' Review: A Bumpy Ride Through a Feminist Life
summary: Alicia Vikander and Julianne Moore star in Julie Taymor's stylized Gloria Steinem biopic that takes as its recurring motif a bus journey through the activist's life and times.. American women owe a debt to Gloria Steinem. Julie Taymor owes her an apology. "The Glorias," an overlong, unfocused and distractingly stylized take on Ms. Steinem's life, commits various sins of self-indulgence, as is the wont of film director Taymor, best known for her Broadway staging of "The Lion King." Her hagiographic treatment of Ms. Steinem's life, which parallels the modern women's movement in America, assumes its viewers know and care deeply about the history being recounted, tells them everything anyway, and sidesteps the inconveniences of basic storytelling. The director also makes her subject something she's never been, which is one big crashing bore.

Patricia Winters and her family decided to take advantage of her husband's remote work arrangement, so they bought a camper. In June, they left their Annapolis, Md., home for a trip out West, with plans to be back in time for school.

title: Trump Would Double Down on Tax Cuts in Second Term
summary: The president would face expiration dates on past tax cuts and push for more. WASHINGTON-In a presidency full of unexpected twists, tax policy under President Trump happened by the book: Republicans got elected and Republicans cut taxes. What happens if they win again? Probably more tax cuts.

title: From Crocs to Nike Dunks, The Grateful Dead Are Taking Over the Shoe Market
summary: The jam band and their iconic dancing bears are having a style moment thanks to a pair of fuzzy Nikes and tie-dye Crocs.. Jerry Garcia never wore Crocs . The Grateful Dead's Gandalfesque frontman died in 1995, seven years before the clog company was even founded. Yet on September 2, Crocs launched a pair of officially licensed Grateful Dead shoes in a resplendent tie-dye pattern. The psyched clogs were a three-way partnership between the band, the Colorado-based clog company and Chinatown Market, a Los Angeles streetwear brand whose products tend to fly off the digital shelves. At just $60, the Dead Crocs were no different: selling out almost the moment they hit the Crocs website. Weeks later, they garner as much as double their retail price on eBay.

title: How Investors Can Profit From the Fight Against Fossil Fuels
summary: Growing green ambitions in Brussels will likely make European carbon credits more expensive for companies but more profitable for investors. It won't be cheap for industrial companies to wean themselves off fossil fuels. Luckily, investors have a way to sit on the opposite side of this trend: European carbon credits.

title: Memorabilia-Trading App Rally Raises $17 Million
summary: Reddit co-founder Alexis Ohanian joined the funding round. A New York-based app on which users can trade against vintage cars, fancy wine and baseball cards just received a cash injection from a handful of investors, including Reddit's co-founder Alexis Ohanian.

title: Fires in Oregon, California Revive Debate Over Spotted Owl Protection
summary: Recent blaze burned in an area where forest-thinning project was on hold due to endangered-species lawsuit. TALENT, Ore.-The wildfires that ravaged the West Coast in recent weeks have renewed a debate in Oregon and Northern California over protections for the northern spotted owl, which some say prevented logging that would have thinned out forests and made the blazes less destructive.

title: The Miami Heat Were 60-to-1 Long Shots. Now They're in the NBA Finals.
summary: The Heat would be the most improbable champion in the modern NBA. All they have to do next is beat LeBron James and the Lakers.. When this NBA season began roughly a century ago, nobody in the league could have anticipated the year to come: a geopolitical crisis in the world's most populous country, a pandemic that would kill hundreds of thousands of Americans, a shutdown of nearly five months, a playoff work stoppage and especially not the NBA Finals being played in a bubble.

title: Home Buyers Give Puerto Rico Another Look During Pandemic
summary: Low taxes lure wealthy buyers to U.S. territory, where luxury developers are reporting brisk business. Sales of Puerto Rican luxury houses and condominiums are spiking during the pandemic, with buyers from New York, California and other higher-tax states embracing the island's low-tax status.

title: Black, Female and Head of a Public Real-Estate Company. Meet the Only Person to Fit That Description.
summary: Leslie D. Hale, a Harvard graduate who worked at Goldman Sachs and GE Capital, has led RLJ Lodging Trust for two years. Leslie D. Hale made history as the first African-American woman to lead a public real-estate investment trust. Today, a little more than two years later, this industry club of female Black chief executives still has just one member.

title: Brookfield Cuts Staff as It Tries to Steady Mall Portfolio
summary: Real-estate company is slowing plans to redevelop malls for other uses. Brookfield Property Partners ' recent move to slash staff shows how the firm's big bet on repurposing shopping malls is slamming into unanticipated challenges during the coronavirus pandemic.

title: Supreme Court Fight to Stir Up Partisan Voters in Pivotal North Carolina Senate Race
summary: GOP hopes nomination of Amy Coney Barrett draws conservatives to Thom Tillis, while Democrats bet their ACA focus helps Cal Cunningham. The death of Justice Ruth Bader Ginsburg upended politics in Washington, thrusting a battle over the ideological direction of the Supreme Court into the final weeks of the election.

title: Japan's NTT to Take Full Control of Mobile Unit in $40 Billion Deal
summary: NTT, which already owns 66% of NTT Docomo, says minority shareholders have hobbled decision-making. TOKYO-NTT Docomo Inc., which broke free of its tradition-minded parent to become a global pioneer of the mobile internet, is returning to its old home in a $40 billion deal that erases its independence.

title: Blackstone Sets Goal to Reduce Carbon Emissions
summary: Firm seeks to cut emissions by 15% on new investments across its portfolio. Blackstone Group Inc., one of the world's largest owners of real estate, is making a new commitment to cut its carbon footprint.

title: LVMH Countersues Tiffany Over Merger
summary: French conglomerate says damage to U.S. jeweler's business invalidates $16 billion deal. LVMH Moët Hennessy Louis Vuitton SE sued Tiffany & Co over their soured merger deal, saying the U.S. jeweler's business has been so deeply damaged during the pandemic that their takeover agreement is invalidated.

title: A $40 Billion Docomo Deal Is a Bitter Pill for Rivals
summary: Investors in Japan's top mobile carrier are set for a huge payday, but its rivals may face big pressure on margins. Japan's new prime minister could shake up its telecom market with potentially the country's largest ever tender offer for its top mobile carrier. Investors in competitors may want to consider roaming elsewhere.

title: Microsoft Thinks You've Been Missing Your Commute in Lockdown
summary: 'Virtual commutes' on Teams aim to rebuild the boundaries between work and home life, and signify the tech firm's move into corporate well-being. Microsoft Corp. is developing an update to its Teams package of workplace collaboration tools to replace one of the less-mourned losses of pandemic living: the commute to and from work.

title: Rwanda's Aggressive Approach to Covid Wins Plaudits-and Warnings
summary: Resume Subscription. Drones mounted with megaphones buzz above Rwanda's streets and villages, reminding pedestrians to social distance. In one clinic, sleek white robots chastise people for not wearing masks. Health workers in protective clothing take test samples from drivers at traffic intersections.

title: Derby's Take: New Research Says Central Bank View on Bond Buying Too Rosy
summary: Resume Subscription. Central bank researchers overestimate the potency of bond buying stimulus efforts, in part because seeing the upside of these strategies benefits their careers, according to a new paper made public Monday.

title: Cities Experiment With Remedy for Poverty: Cash, No Strings Attached
summary: Guaranteed income comes without work requirements; some worry about work disincentive, high cost. Last year, Stockton, Calif., embarked on a civic experiment. For 18 months the city would send $500 a month to 125 randomly selected households in low-income neighborhoods. Researchers would compare the effect on participants' health and economic situation to that of residents who didn't get payments.

title: Gold's Record High Gives New Life to Dollar Doomsayers
summary: This year ranks as one of the best on record for investors in the precious metal, with futures prices up almost 24% for 2020. Can gold keep going?

title: Dollar Regains Draw in Carry Trades
summary: Cost of using dollars to buy higher-yielding currencies is expected to remain low after the Fed pinned interest rates near zero. This year's decline in the U.S. dollar is drawing investors back into a practice that they had eschewed for some years: Borrowing the greenback to buy riskier assets in what is known as a carry trade.

title: Pepper...and Salt
summary: Resume Subscription. We are delighted that you'd like to resume your subscription.

title: Ransomware Attack Hits Universal Health Services
summary: One of nation's largest hospital chains diverted ambulances, canceled surgeries because of malware. Computer systems at Universal Health Services Inc., one of the nation's largest hospital chains, were taken offline after a malicious software attack crippled the company's computers and led it to cancel some surgeries and divert some ambulances.

title: Tampa Bay Lightning Win the Stanley Cup
summary: With a 2-0 victory in Game 6 over the Dallas Stars, Tampa Bay secured its second NHL title. The Tampa Bay Lightning won the Stanley Cup on Monday with a 2-0 win over the Dallas Stars, securing their first title since 2004 and affirming the team's place as one of the most dominant NHL franchises of recent years.

title: Microsoft Office 365, Azure Cloud Disrupted by Service Issues
summary: Company says problems included some users of its Outlook email services. Microsoft Corp. on Monday suffered disruptions with its Office 365 workplace software tools and its Azure cloud that disabled some users for hours.

title: Hertz CFO Steps Down After Less Than Two Months, Forfeits Bonus
summary: Move comes as the car-rental company is looking for a bankruptcy loan amid a pandemic that has upended the travel industry. Hertz Global Holdings Inc. named its second finance chief in as many months Monday, as the troubled car-rental company navigates a tumultuous bankruptcy process.

title: California Wildfires Force Tens of Thousands to Evacuate
summary: Glass Fire spreads across 11,000 acres, charring same region burned in 2017, in latest blaze of record-setting wildfire year. SANTA ROSA, Calif.-Thick clouds of brown smoke billowed in the sky, and chunks of ash bigger than a hand fell to the ground Monday as this city in the heart of California's wine country was hit by fires for the second time in three years.

title: Global Coronavirus Deaths Surpass One Million
summary: U.S. accounts for nearly a fifth of the more than 33.1 million Covid-19 cases reported globally. The death toll from the coronavirus pandemic reached one million world-wide on Monday, as several nations continue to struggle to contain a virus that has overloaded health-care systems, upended economies and remade daily life around the globe.

title: Democrats Unveil $2.2 Trillion Coronavirus Stimulus Bill
summary: Vote could come later this week on House package that faces likely hurdles in GOP-led Senate. WASHINGTON-House Democrats released a $2.2 trillion coronavirus relief package that would restore $600 weekly jobless benefits, a last-ditch effort to revive stalled talks with the White House.

title: EPA Raises Legal Questions About California Ban on Gas-Powered Cars
summary: Gov. Gavin Newsom's mandate could strain electric grid, environmental agency chief says. WASHINGTON-The Environmental Protection Agency raised concerns about California Gov. Gavin Newsom's plan to ban sales of new gasoline and diesel-powered passenger cars in the state by 2035, arguing that the mandate is impractical and possibly illegal.

title: Senators Set Up Meetings With Supreme Court Nominee Amy Coney Barrett
summary: GOP moves ahead with tight schedule aiming to put her on the bench by Election Day. WASHINGTON-Republican senators, joined by some Democrats, are lining up meetings with Supreme Court nominee Amy Coney Barrett ahead of her confirmation hearing in two weeks, as GOP leaders moved ahead with plans to have President Trump's pick on the bench by Election Day.
